ygData.subject: Re: The Awakened
ygData.msgSnippet: Vorpal: Hunting someone down? No, there would be too much work even for us Minions. No, we have been outnumbered in our sleep, something Master Unicron had not

Vorpal: Hunting someone down? No, there would be too much work even
for us Minions. No, we have been outnumbered in our sleep, something
Master Unicron had not planned. We cannot hunt people down. We have to
start a war, but we must do this in a methodical way.

He ordered the reactivation of the section after Darkfate was out of
it, then summoned a holoprojection of Earth.

Vorpal: I need you all to scout. We need to establish how well
defended their production facilities are in order to plan our attacks.
There are two places where you must NEVER go though...

He brought up images of the Cryonosis Tower and of Mount Olympus.

Vorpal: These are two of the Cybertronians' most heavily defended
positions. Cryonosis is a monitoring station that seems to be watching
us. Eventually, we will have to take it out, but not yet. Olympus
Complex, on the other hand, is the dedicated central military
facility. It is a place so well defended we must not hope to leave
there unscathed. For now, though, we will concentrate on their orbital
facilities. Go, and report all that you see! 

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Airly" <airly2002@h...> wrote:
> Nightstrike/Darkfate:
> 
> "I don't have any problem... and after this, I guess that Darkfate
neither"replied Nightstrike"What important thing will do?? hunt down
thore treacherous laidies??? they are a danger that should be
eradicated as soon as possible, I guess that MAster Unicron told ya bout"
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Nic 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Saturday, July 09, 2005 12:30 PM
>   Subject: Re: The Awakened
> 
> 
>   Vorpal: You are right. Do you hear that, Darkfate? You owe 
>   Nightstrike your life now! Drones, deactivate this section.
> 
>   The electrical tension suddenly stopped, allowing Darkfate to get 
>   out of the trench.
> 
>   Vorpal: Can we finally stop bickering about my leadership and get 
>   down to important things, now?
